column3: HMRC won’t email about tax rebates or penalties so it could be a scam. Look out for bad spelling, odd addresses & generic greetings. If you’re unsure, contact HMRC using the options on their website. You can find more advice on avoiding fraud here:http://grp.hsbc/SecurityCentre

column3: Hi Dan, any funds pending into your HSBC account are subject to timescales of the sender. For example, retail refunds can take 7-10 working days, international payments 3-4 working days, UK2UK payments are usually instant, etc. As a receiving bank, we don't affect this. ^Mill

column3: The issue with URLs is masking. I agree that it's good to visually inspect the email address, but this is just the address at the end of the day. Risk comes from clicking on a malicious (mostly masked as genuine) link. This is why hovering over URL helps identify it. ^Mill
